REACT_APP_home.title: Huldra: Visual Acuity Test
REACT_APP_home.signupText: If you don't have a participant ID, you can have one by clicking the button below.
REACT_APP_home.additionalText: Please view this application in full screen mode.

Q6.label: What type of device are you using to participate in the study?

Q7.label: Do you wear Glasses or contact lenses?

Q8.label: I understand that my participation in this study is voluntary, my responses will remain confidential

Q10.label: Have you ever been diagnosed with any of the following vision conditions? (Select all that apply)

Q11.label: Are you participating in this study under normal lighting conditions?

REACT_APP_background.sectionText: We are conducting a user study to evaluate how variations in visual acuity, color perception, and screen contrast influence user experience and survey accuracy. Your participation helps improve digital accessibility standards. To ensure that all participants can accurately perceive the visual content presented in this survey, we have included two preliminary assessments before the main study begins:

sectionContent.title: Color Vision Assessment (Ishihara Test)
sectionContent.text: This test detects red-green color vision deficiencies to determine whether color perception might impact how participants interpret visual explanations.
sectionContent.text1: Look at the image: Each plate contains numbers or patterns made of colored dots.
sectionContent.text2: Identify the number: Enter the number you see or write "Cannot see" if no number is visible.

sectionContent.title: Screen Contrast Test
sectionContent.text: This test evaluates the contrast quality of the participant’s display to ensure that screen limitations do not affect their ability to differentiate visual elements
sectionContent.text1: Observe the color bars: Each bar contains multiple shades of the same color.
sectionContent.text2: Count the shades: Select the number of distinct shades you can see.

REACT_APP_background.sectionText: There are different ways of explaining why an AI model predicts a specific outcome. AI helps detect polyps from gastrointestinal images, for medical diagnosis. In the following, AI has detected a polyp. There are different ways of explaining why the model predicts this outcome. Explanation methods mostly fall into 2 categories: we call these intrinsic (saliency based) and dataset based. Each category is further described below:

sectionContent.text1: Intrinsic (Saliency Based):  Saliency-based explanations use heatmaps (red = important, blue = less important) to show where the AI is focusing.
sectionContent.text2: Dataset Based: Dataset-based explanations compare images, with green regions supporting AI predictions and red regions opposing them.

REACT_APP_background.sectionText: In this part of our study, you will first watch a short video clip of a goal event. Then, you will see two alternative thumbnail images representing the video, and you’ll pick the thumbnail you prefer or feel is most representative.

sectionContent.text: On the following page, you will see one of these thumbnails again, displayed in two different ways:
sectionContent.text2: Simulated: A version that mimics how someone with color blindness might see the image.

popupA.mainTitle: Compare original image with Option A

caseImageColumnRight.title: Your Answer
caseImageColumnRight.text: Please click on one of the images (option A or B) to place it on top. Do not drag and drop the image. The top image is your preferred option for this case.
